intro: Licania lifouana, commonly known as the Lifouan licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Pacific island of Lifou in New Caledonia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, palmate leaves, and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species with limited ecological and botanical study.
